# wait(duration:)

**Type Method**

Creates an action that idles for a specified period of time.

## Declaration

```swift
class func wait(duration sec: TimeInterval) -> SCNAction
```

## Parameters

- **sec**: The amount of time to wait.

## Return Value

A new action object.

## Discussion

When the action executes, the action waits for the specified amount of time and then ends. This is typically used as part of a sequence of actions to insert a delay between two other actions. You might also use it in conjunction with the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNActionable/runAction(_:completionHandler:)] method to trigger code that needs to run at a later time.

This action is not reversible; the reverse of this action is the same action.

## Creating Actions That Add Delays to Action Sequences

- **wait(duration:withRange:)**: Creates an action that idles for a randomized period of time.
